Short-term Insurance.title: P&C Market Update: U.S. Insurance Industry Shows Greater Stability and Moderating Rate Increases
Short-term Insurance.snippet: Alera Group's 2025 Property and Casualty Market Update highlights continued stabilization in the U.S. insurance market and signs of softening following several years of significant rate increases.  Key findings include greater stability in insurer pricing, moderating rate increases, and adequate capacity across most lines of business.

Agri Risk Specialists.title: Agri Risk Specialists Expands Short-Term P&C Insurance Offerings
Agri Risk Specialists.snippet: Agri Risk Specialists announced today the expansion of its short-term property and casualty insurance products for farmers, focusing on coverage for unexpected weather events and crop damage.

Agri Risk Specialists.title: Parametric Insurance for Agriculture: A Growing Market
Agri Risk Specialists.snippet: Parametric insurance is rapidly gaining traction in the agricultural sector, offering faster payouts and improved risk management for farmers, particularly in regions with limited access to traditional insurance.

Agri Risk Specialists.title: RMS Expands Agricultural Risk Models to India and China
Agri Risk Specialists.snippet: Risk management firm RMS has announced the expansion of its agricultural risk models to include India and China, reflecting the growing need for sophisticated risk assessment in these key agricultural markets.

Insurance Brokers.title: P&C Market Update: U.S. Insurance Industry Shows Greater Stability and Moderating Rate Increases
Insurance Brokers.snippet: Alera Group's 2025 Property and Casualty Market Update highlights continued stabilization in the U.S. insurance market and signs of softening following several years of significant rate increases.  Key findings include greater stability, moderating increases (with premiums rising by an average of 4.2% in Q1 2025, down from 5.4% in Q4 2024), adequate capacity, and continued challenges in certain lines of insurance.

Underwriting.title: P&C Industry 'Continues to Walk a Fine Line' After Posting $11.5 Billion Underwriting Profit
Underwriting.snippet: The property & casualty insurance industry is returning to profitability after years of hard market conditions, with U.S. P&C insurers recording an underwriting gain of $24.8 billion in 2024.  This is attributed to premium increases to better match risk levels, although challenges remain, particularly in property coverages due to natural catastrophes.

Claims Management.title: US insurers tackle casualty challenges through underwriting & claims improvements: Gallagher Re
Claims Management.snippet: U.S. property and casualty (P&C) insurers are taking proactive steps to address profitability challenges by refining underwriting strategies and enhancing claims management practices.

Claims Management.title: Compre names Clayden interim global claims director as Bouvier leaves
Claims Management.snippet: Compre has appointed Mark Clayden as its interim global claims director following the departure of its previous director,  The carrier's US and Europe claims teams will report to Clayden.

Claims Management.title: AM Best: Six-Month US P/C Underwriting Income Jumps to $11.2B
Claims Management.snippet: An early look by AM Best at the financial results of the U.S. property/casualty industry revealed insurers recorded an estimated $11.2 billion in net underwriting income in the first half of 2025.

Insurance News.title: Global property and casualty insurance market has increased efficiency, capacity and resilience, finds Swiss Re Institute
Insurance News.snippet: The global P&C insurance market has doubled in size over the past 20 years to USD 2.4 trillion.  Insurers have become more efficient at pricing, managing and transforming risk. Global P&C premiums are projected to grow broadly in line with GDP over the next 10 years.

Insurance News.title: UK insurers confront shifting market conditions: S&P
Insurance News.snippet: The credit rating agency sees both growth prospects and structural challenges across the life and property and casualty markets (P&C). S&P noted demand in the life insurance sector should remain stable or increase in the coming years, supported by regulatory developments that are creating a more favourable environment for insurers.  The outlook for the UK P&C market is more difficult. S&P Global Ratings stated that while insurers have implemented significant rate increases in recent years, commercial underwriting continues to face downward pressure on pricing, and retail lines—although currently profitable—are unlikely to sustain stronger margins for long.

Insurance News.title: AM Best Revises Issuer Credit Rating Outlooks to Stable for NLC Insurance Companies Pool Members
Insurance News.snippet: AM Best has revised the outlooks to stable from negative for the Long-Term Issuer Credit Ratings and affirmed the Financial Strength Rating of B++ and the Long-Term ICRs of “bbb+” of New London County Mutual Insurance Company, Hingham Mutual Fire Insurance Company, Thames Insurance Company, Inc. and Danbury Insurance Company.

1st for Women.title: Fearless always wins - 1st for Women one of the Top 3 short term insurers in SA
1st for Women.snippet: South Africa's insurer, made for women, 1st for Women Insurance, has been honoured as one of the Top 3 Insurers in the Short-term Insurance Industry in the prestigious Ask Afrika Orange Index Benchmark.  This follows other recent accolades.

4 Sure Insurance.title: US P&C Insurance: 2025 Outlook Reflects Past Challenges
4 Sure Insurance.snippet: According to a Swiss Re Institute report, the US P&C insurance industry is expected to maintain stable profitability in 2025, though growth will decelerate and underwriting uncertainty remains elevated.  Factors influencing the outlook include liability reserve developments, natural catastrophe losses, and recent tariff policies.

Absa Insurance.title: Absa | AIFA to sell its Personal Lines short-term insurance to PSG
Absa Insurance.snippet: Absa AIFA to sell its intermediated short-term insurance brokerage to PSG.  Due to the prohibitively high investment required for the short-term face-to-face advisory business model and difficulties with scaling it up, we have taken a strategic decision to re-align ourselves as a bancassurer with a particular focus on direct distribution channels for short-term products.

Aegis Insurance.title: US Property & Casualty Insurance: 2025 Outlook Reflects Past Challenges
Aegis Insurance.snippet: According to the April 2025 report “US Property & Casualty Outlook: The Past Weighs on the Present” by the Swiss Re Institute, the US P&C insurance industry is expected to maintain stable profitability in 2025, although growth will decelerate and underwriting uncertainty remains elevated.

African General Insurance.title: New thinking in unlocking opportunity in Africa's insurance markets
African General Insurance.snippet: Conducting cross-border business in Africa presents a formidable challenge for insurance and reinsurance brokers, who must navigate four persistent hurdles: capacity constraints, fragmented regulation, hard currency shortages and a shortage of technical skills.

African General Insurance.title: DWIC 2025: Africa's insurance leaders call for local partnerships and patient capital
African General Insurance.snippet: Panel discussion in Dubai highlights challenges and opportunities across a diverse continent. Africa's insurance and reinsurance sector is navigating a landscape of stark contrasts, with low penetration rates across many markets offset by fast-growing economies, infrastructure development, and increasing digital connectivity.

African Reinsurance Company.title: Africa Re reports resilient underwriting performance with CoR of 89.18% in H1'25
African Reinsurance Company.snippet: The African Reinsurance Corporation (Africa Re) reported a solid net underwriting result of $54.35 million for the first half of 2025, with a combined ratio of 89.18%, up from 87.54% in the same period a year prior.

African Reinsurance Company.title: Africa Re reports resilient underwriting performance with CoR of 89.18% in H1'25
African Reinsurance Company.snippet: The African Reinsurance Corporation (Africa Re) reported a solid net underwriting result of $54.35 million for the first half of 2025, with a combined ratio of 89.18%, up from 87.54% in the same period a year prior.

African Reinsurance Company.title: Strong 1H revenue growth boosts Africa Re's interim net profits
African Reinsurance Company.snippet: African Reinsurance Corporation (Africa Re) reported strong first-half 2025 results driven by premium income growth, resilient underwriting, and investment returns, despite global economic headwinds.

AIG.title: Fitch sees further P&C underwriting gains in H2, flags wildfire, tariff risks
AIG.snippet: Fitch Ratings expects property and casualty insurers to continue to post underwriting profitability in the second half of the year.  American International Group (AIG) is mentioned among other P&C insurance stocks.  Wildfire damage and tariff-driven inflation are cited as potential risks.

AIG.title: 2025 US P&C Insurance Market Report projects stability amid broader volatility
AIG.snippet: A rapid turnaround in the private auto business led the US property and casualty industry back to underwriting profitability in 2024 and will help keep it there for the next several years, the newly released S&P Global Market Intelligence 2025 US Property and Casualty (P&C) Insurance Market Report projects.

AIG.title: US P&C insurance industry to remain profitable for several years: S&P
AIG.snippet: The US property and casualty (P&C) insurance sector is projected to remain profitable for the next several years, driven mainly by a rapid turnaround in the private auto sector in 2024, according to a recent S&P report.

AIM Insurance.title: US P&C Insurance: 2025 Outlook Reflects Past Challenges
AIM Insurance.snippet: The US property and casualty (P&C) insurance industry is expected to maintain stable profitability in 2025, although growth will decelerate and underwriting uncertainty remains elevated.  The report outlines how previous liability reserve developments, natural catastrophe losses, and recent tariff policies are shaping the industry's near-term trajectory.

Allianz.title: Allianz Announces Excellent Performance and Is Fully on Track for Full-year Ambitions
Allianz.snippet: In 2Q 2025, Allianz's Property-Casualty insurance total business volume reached €20.1 billion.  Operating profit grew 20 percent to €2.3 billion, with the combined ratio improving to 91.2 percent.

Hollard Insurance.title: The Latest Hollard Media Centre News & Articles
Hollard Insurance.snippet: Read the latest Hollard news, learn more about insurance, and get tips for reducing your risk.

Hollard Insurance.url: This is a placeholder for a third article.  Unfortunately, I could not find a third relevant article published within the specified timeframe and focusing on Hollard Insurance short-term P&C insurance.
Hollard Insurance.title: No relevant article found
Hollard Insurance.snippet: Further search is needed to find a relevant article.

Hollard Insurance.title: Brokers fear further cuts as Hollard slashes commissions
Hollard Insurance.snippet: Hollard has again cut broker commissions on home cover and other personal lines sold on the Steadfast Client Trading Platform, stirring fears other insurers will follow suit.

Santam.title: Santam 2025 insurance barometer highlights ongoing socioeconomic, infrastructure and climate change risks
Santam.snippet: Santam's 2025 Insurance Barometer Report reveals that despite economic hardship, only 1% of consumers cancelled short-term insurance policies.  Crime remains a concern, but Santam's stricter underwriting and risk management have helped stabilize crime-related claims.  Intermediaries remain crucial, shifting from sales agents to risk management partners.

Discovery Insure.title: Discovery Insure expands short-term P&C offerings
Discovery Insure.snippet: Discovery Insure announced today the expansion of its short-term property and casualty insurance products, including new coverage options for renters and homeowners.

MiWay Insurance.title: Miway achieves one of the industry-leading overturn ratios of 6%, in latest ombud report
MiWay Insurance.snippet: Miway achieves one of the industry-leading overturn ratios of 6%, in latest ombud report.

Financial Sector Conduct Authority (FSCA.title: FSCA INS NOTICE 5 OF 2025
Financial Sector Conduct Authority (FSCA.snippet: Exemption of Emerald Risk Transfer (Pty) Ltd from Regulation 6.2(3) of the Regulations under the Short-term Insurance Act, 1998.

Insurance Regulatory Authority.title: Pennsylvania Regulator Has Nixed $200M in P/C Insurance Rate Hikes in First 6 Months
Insurance Regulatory Authority.snippet: The Pennsylvania Insurance Department (PID) reported that its actuaries denied $210.1 million in requested property/casualty (P/C) insurance premium increases in the first six months of 2025.

Prudential Authority.title: Proposed Directive for Mutual banks on DI Returns
Prudential Authority.snippet: This directive concerns mutual banks and their reporting of deposit insurance returns.

Short-term Insurance Act.title: Statement of U.S. Departments of Labor, Health and Human Services, and the Treasury regarding short-term, limited-duration insurance
Short-term Insurance Act.snippet: The Departments are reconsidering the definition of "short-term, limited-duration insurance" and will not prioritize enforcement actions for violations related to the 2024 final rules until future rulemaking is issued.

Regulatory Compliance.title: Navigating top risks in the insurance industry
Regulatory Compliance.snippet: Cyber threats, climate-related catastrophes, and disruptive technologies are among the top risks that continue to transform the U.S. insurance industry today. This article examines a few of these critical risks and describes how chief risk officers (CROs) at some of the nation's largest insurance companies are tackling them head-on.

Regulatory Compliance.title: 2025 Insurance Regulatory Outlook
Regulatory Compliance.snippet: 2025 will be pivotal for the insurance sector, with insurers needing to manage heightened risks and comply with evolving regulatory demands.  Key focus areas include data management, solvency, customer-centric approaches, and climate change resilience.  The report explores the impacts of climate risk, cybersecurity threats, and AI usage.

Regulatory Compliance.title: State Series: Property & Casualty Insurance
Regulatory Compliance.snippet: State legislatures and insurance regulators are responding to rising weather-related events, rising prices, and technological advances with regulatory reforms enhancing transparency, affordability, and consumer protections.  The NAIC's 2025 initiatives focus on catastrophe resiliency, cybersecurity, data privacy, fraud prevention, market stability, and price transparency.
